name: market for sand-lime brick | sand-lime brick | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/2963/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'sand-lime brick', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;The product "sand-lime brick" represents 1 kg of sand-lime brick produced from natural silica sand, milled quicklime, additives and water. Its production includes raw material provision, raw material mixing, forming by pressing, hardening by autoclave, packing, and storage. Sand-lime lightweight bricks are insulating bricks with a low apparent density (œÅ = 700 to 900 kg/m3). The most important use of sand-lime bricks in the building sector are: Masonry (supporting walls, parting wall, casing), fair-faced brickwork and Facing/Casing. 

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'sand-lime brick',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of 'sand-lime brick',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
